sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
Groovebasin is a music player server with a web-based user interface.

Run it on a server connected to some speakers in your home or office. Guests can control the music player by connecting with a laptop, tablet, or smart phone. Further, you can stream your music library remotely.

Groove Basin works with your personal music library; not an external music service. Groove Basin will never support DRM content.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Install the nodejs-groovebasinAUR package from the Arch User Repository.

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content: A configuration file is located in /etc/groovebasin.json you need to provide groovebasin with a configuration file or it will create a new one in the current directory named config.json.

sections.title: Start the Server
sections.content:
To start groovebasin as a regular user run

```
$ groovebasin --start
```

A unit file is also available to start groovebasin.service.
